GEOPOLITICAL.Definition: related to politics and the geography of an area

HERITAGE.Definition: valued things(ideas, customs etc.) that are transferred by previous generations

PRESERVATION.Definition: the act of keeping something without changing it

SCULPTURE.Definition: the art of creating objects from a material (usually stone or wood)

CABINET.Definition: piece of furniture made to store things

THE UNTRAINED EYE.Definition: someone who doesn't have the knowledge of something

LUMP.Definition: a small piece of something, with no particular shape

UNFAIR.Definition: not treated in an equal and just way

HIEROGLYPHICS.Definition: a system of writing using pictures instead of letters

PROVINCE.Definition: a part of an empire or country

HIEROGLYPHIC.Definition: a system of writing using pictures instead of letters

POTS.Definition: a kind of round container, used for cooking

PANS.Definition: a kind of round container, used for cooking

PARALLEL TEXTS.Definition: texts containing different versions of the same work

COLONIALISM.Definition: the practice of one country controlling another one

EXPANSIONISM.Definition: the belief that a country should grow bigger

BREAKTHROUGH.Definition: an important event that gave an answer to a problem

STRONGHOLD.Definition: an area where a particular group has a very strong position

COLONY.Definition: a country or area controlled by another country

SHREWD.Definition: clever, with a good judgement of a situation

CULTURAL HERITAGE.Definition: valued things (such as ideas and customs) that are transferred by previous generations

PREEMPTIVE.Definition: something that is done to prevent something from happening by taking action first

SOFT POWER.Definition: the use of a country's cultural and economic influence to make other countries do something

MOVE.Definition: an action taken to achieve something

FORTRESS.Definition: a strong building that can provide defense during an attack

COLLEAGUES.Definition: persons with whom one works together

EXAMINED.Definition: to be looked at in detail, inspected

THE KEY.Definition: a thing that provides ways of understanding something

EXAMINE.Definition: look at something in detail, inspect

POSSESSION.Definition: the fact that you have or own something

SUNK.Definition: went down, below the surface of water

SURRENDERED.Definition: stopped resisting to the enemy and accepted defeat

SURRENDER.Definition: an agreement to stop fighting and accept defeat

LOANED.Definition: given for a limited period of time

PRIDE.Definition: a feeling of pleasure and satisfaction you get as a part of belonging in a particular group

DECIPHERING.Definition: discovering the meaning of something written in a difficult or hidden way

SIMILARITIES.Definition: things that make something look like something else

HIEROGLYPHS.Definition: written characters that look like a picture

HYPOTHESISED.Definition: given a possible but not yet proved explanation of something

HIEROGLYPH.Definition: written character that looks like a picture

DESTINED.Definition: certain to meet a particular fate

OVERNIGHT.Definition: something that lasts just a night, brief

CODE.Definition: a system of words, numbers, letters or signs that is hard to understand

LEGEND HAS IT.Definition: something that is rumoured to be true

BROKE TIES.Definition: broke their relationship, stopped working together

INSTRUMENTAL.Definition: very important in helping something to happen

PRESERVED.Definition: kept in its original state or in good condition

REMAIN.Definition: continue to stay at the same place
